intro: Spilanthes nuttallii, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Spilanthes nuttallii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various therapeutic purposes.
